definitions.definition: a tribunal presided over by a judge, judges, or a magistrate in civil and criminal cases.
examples: a settlement was reached during the first sitting of the court

definitions.definition: the place where a court meets.
the judge or judges presiding at a court.
a quadrangular area, either open or covered, marked out for ball games such as tennis or basketball.
a quadrangular area surrounded by a building or group of buildings.
a subdivision of a building, usually a large hall extending to the ceiling with galleries and staircases.
the establishment, retinue, and courtiers of a sovereign.
examples: the emperor is shown with his court

definitions.definition: a sovereign and his or her councilors, constituting a ruling power.
examples: relations between the king and the imperial court
royal residence, palace, castle, chateau she made her way to the queen's court

definitions.definition: be involved with romantically, typically with the intention of marrying.
examples: he was courting a girl from the neighboring farm
synonyms: seek the hand of "he's courting her sister"

definitions.definition: (of a male bird or other animal) try to attract (a mate).
pay special attention to (someone) in an attempt to win their support or favor.
examples: Western politicians courted the leaders of the newly independent states
synonyms: ingratiate oneself with; Moreinformalsuck up to
butter up "a newspaper editor who was courted by senior politicians"

definitions.definition: go to great lengths to win (favorable attention).
examples: he never had to court the approval of the political elite
synonyms: solicit "he was busily courting public attention"

definitions.definition: risk incurring (misfortune) because of the way one behaves.
synonyms: bring on oneself "he has often courted controversy"
